skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance files. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem modifications, and no environment variable access. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Create skills for Claude Code plugins
content.value_statement: Users struggle to build modular, reusable skills for Claude Code plugins. This skill provides a systematic 6-step process with progressive disclosure design principles to create effective skills that extend Claude's capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Define skill anatomy with SKILL.md and bundled resources
Implement progressive disclosure for token efficiency
Write effective trigger phrases and descriptions
Structure scripts, references, and assets directories
Validate skills against best practices checklist
limitations: Does not execute or test skills directly
Does not generate code for skills automatically
Does not install or deploy skills to environments
Focused on Claude Code plugins only, not generic skills

use_cases.title: Build plugin skills
use_cases.description: Create skills for custom Claude Code plugins with proper structure and documentation

use_cases.title: Design skill architecture
use_cases.description: Apply progressive disclosure principles to design token-efficient, modular skills

use_cases.title: Document skill workflows
use_cases.description: Organize skill content with references, examples, and scripts for optimal AI consumption

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants to create a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill for my Claude Code plugin. The skill should handle [specific use cases]

prompt_templates.title: Structure skill files
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the correct directory structure and file organization for a skill with scripts, references, and assets

prompt_templates.title: Write skill description
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write an effective frontmatter description with specific trigger phrases for my [skill type] skill

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill against the validation checklist. Check the SKILL.md structure, trigger phrases, and progressive disclosure

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for handling PDF documents in my plugin
output: Step 1: Understand use cases - PDF rotation, extraction, conversion
Step 4: Write SKILL.md with trigger phrases like 'rotate PDF', 'extract text from PDF'
Step 5: Validate against checklist - frontmatter, writing style, references

best_practices: Use third-person description with specific trigger phrases users would say
Keep SKILL.md lean (1,500-2,000 words) and move detailed content to references/
Write in imperative/infinitive form for clarity and AI consumption
anti_patterns: Putting all content in SKILL.md without using references/ directory
Using second person (You should) instead of imperative form
Writing vague trigger descriptions without specific user query examples

faq.question: What is the minimum required structure for a skill?
faq.answer: A skill requires only a SKILL.md file with YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields.

faq.question: What is progressive disclosure in skills?
faq.answer: A three-level loading system: metadata always in context, SKILL.md body when triggered, and bundled resources loaded as needed.

faq.question: How do trigger phrases work?
faq.answer: Specific user queries in the frontmatter description determine when the skill activates, like 'create a hook' or 'rotate PDF'.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads documentation and does not access files, environment variables, or make network requests.

faq.question: Why use scripts/ directory in skills?
faq.answer: Scripts store deterministic, reusable code that can be executed without loading into the context window, saving tokens.

faq.question: How is this different from the generic skill-creator?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically for Claude Code plugins with simpler structure, while skill-creator uses init_skill.py for standalone skills.
